news.title: Steve Jobs Once Cited Leonardo Da Vinci's Example To Explain Why All 'Major' Thinkers Had This Trait That Made Them Exceptional
news.summary: Steve Jobs once argued the greatest innovators are "both the thinker and doer in one person," invoking Leonardo da Vinci to prove that creativity and execution rarely succeed apart. What Happened: Addressing engineers in the early 1990s, the Apple (NASDAQ:APPL) co-founder said, "The doers are the major thinkers. ... Did Leonardo have a guy off to the side thinking five years out what he would paint? Of course not. Leonardo was the artist, but he also mixed all his own paints." Trending: Maker of
